answers.answer: Please be tested for protein in your blood, You have all the symptoms, my cousin was just diagnosed with it. It needs to be addressed ASAP.

Hi,Pins and needles sensations raise the suspicion of conditions like diabetes, thyroid dysfunction and B 12 deficiency.Other possibilities include chronic fatigue syndrome and fibromyalgia. I can understand your anxiety but very little can be done before you see your doctor. For one you can take B complex supplements and see if they help.Do keep us posted.

question: I have an appointment with my doctor scheduled for Monday but this has been really bothering me.  My symptoms started about two weeks ago and have gotten worse.  It started out with the feeling of pins and needles in my head but would go away.  Now it is throughout my entire body.  It's like I'm being stabbed by millions of electrified needles and then it itches.  On top of that I have been extremely tired but NO muscle fatigue!  I've felt nauseous and dizzy but only about once or twice a day.  Also my tongue feels huge but Advil has been helping.  I've recently lost about 15 lbs and have changed my diet so the symptoms lead me to think it's B12 deficiency but I'm not sure (I don't eat a lot of red meat but have recently)  I'm still working out but not as much as I was two weeks ago because of being overall tired.  Is there anything I can do until Monday to help with the pins and needles pain?  I'm really hoping this is not serious but I am a bit nervous about what it could be.
title: Pins and Needles Feeling
